intro: Cyclosorus jaculosus, commonly known as the golden star liverwort, is a small, perennial liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped thallus that is covered in tiny, leaf-like structures called phyllids. This plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or rocky crevices, where it thrives in high humidity. Its reproductive structures, known as gemmae, are produced in clusters and aid in vegetative propagation. Cyclosorus jaculosus is an important indicator species for assessing the health of wetland and forest ecosystems.
